meanings.definition: To squeeze or grip (something) tightly between finger and thumb.
meanings.sent1: She pinches the dough to make small cookies.
meanings.sent2: He pinches his sister's arm playfully.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous elf pinches the cookies from the jar.
meanings.sent4: Time pinches at our memories like a relentless hand.
meanings.sent5: The cold wind pinches my cheeks as I walk outside.

meanings.definition: A small amount of something, typically salt or spice.
meanings.sent1: Add a pinch of salt to the soup for flavor.
meanings.sent2: She sprinkled a pinch of cinnamon on the apple pie.
meanings.sent3: The recipe calls for a pinch of magic to make it perfect.
meanings.sent4: His words added a pinch of humor to the conversation.
meanings.sent5: The pinch of sugar in the tea made it just right.

meanings.definition: A feeling of sharp pain or discomfort.
meanings.sent1: She winces at the pinch in her side.
meanings.sent2: The pinch in his back made him groan.
meanings.sent3: The pinch of embarrassment faded as she laughed it off.
meanings.sent4: The pinch of regret lingered long after the mistake.
meanings.sent5: The pinch of hunger gnawed at her stomach.
